Developer Guide¶

This guide is a resource for contributing to the Allen Wrench library. It is maintained by the Allen Institute for Brain Science.

Quick Start (Linux)¶

  1. Download the source distribution.

    wget http://bamboo.corp.alleninstitute.org/browse/MAT-AWBS/latestSuccessful/artifact/shared/tgz/allen_wrench-0.1.1.tar.gz

  2. Unpack the source code.

    tar -x -v --ungzip -f allen_wrench-0.1.1.tar.gz

  3. Install using setuptools

    cd allen_wrench-0.1.1
python setup.py install

  4. Run the tests with coverage

    python setup.py nosetests

  5. Rebuild from source

    make clean doc sdist

Other Distribution Formats¶

  • allen_wrench-0.1.1.tar.gz
  • allen_wrench-0.1.1.tar.bz2
  • allen_wrench-0.1.1.zip

Build Server¶

  • Allen Institute Internal Bamboo Server
  • Allen Wrench / Biophys Sim Combined build

Unit test results and code coverage reports can be found on here.

Editing Documentation¶

Static documentation is in .rst files under the doc_template directory. Add your new file (without the .rst extension) to the toclist in index.rst. The document syntax is reStructuredText and is rebuilt by the Makefile (‘make clean doc’). The generated html documentation can be found at doc/index.html

For API docstring documentation, refer to PEP-0257 for conventions. Please document all important packages, classes and methods.

Required Dependencies¶

  • NumPy
  • SciPy
  • MatPlotLib
  • lxml <http://lxml.de>`_
  • json <http://docs.python.org/2/library/json.html>`_

Optional Dependencies¶

  • nose is nicer testing for python
  • coverage
  • mpi4py is a message passing interface for distributed processing
